title: Architectural Model, "Renaissance Church", 1600–1700
medium: Cut, carved and molded wood with carved, painted and gessoed decoration
inscribed: FERDINANDUS MED. MAGIRUS DUX ?T?PRUS AE III
provenance: 2014, Acquired by Cooper Hewitt Smithsonian Design Museum from Eugene V Thaw and Clare E. Thaw

description: in the form of a Renaissance chapel abutting a brick building behind it, the chapel's front portico of single story, with three arches raised on double columns, surmounted by a single window in the wall, below an open triangular pediment, the back building with three roof tops.
